conclusion: Result that has to be obtained: emf of the source E = 5 V, internal resistance r = 5 Ω
For any source U = E – I r, so the U-I graph is a straight line whose y-intercept gives E and whose (negative) gradient gives r.
From the graph: Point A: I = 0.20 A, U = 4 V
From the graph: Point B: I = 0.80 A, U = 1 V
Gradient (slope) m = (U_B – U_A)/(I_B – I_A) = (1 V – 4 V)/(0.80 A – 0.20 A) = –3 V/0.60 A = –5 V A⁻¹
Intercept (at I = 0) U = –5 I + b → using point A: 4 V = –5 × 0.20 A + b ⇒ b = 5 V.
